sources.title: The Phantom Planet
sources.description: Classic sci-fi from 1961. A rocket crashes on an invisible planet during an investigation. The surviving astronaut encounters a race of miniature people: the women are VERY interested! The low budget belies the fact films like this were thematically the precursor to modern sci-fi. [NB - This feature film currently comes in 2 parts, please download both of the .MP4 files listed on the left-hand side of the page in order to grab the entire film.] Part 1 Part 2 You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: The Phantom Planet
sources.description: Title: The Phantom Planet Summary: After an invisible asteroid draws an astronaut and his ship to its surface, he is miniaturized by the phantom planet's exotic atmosphere. Directed by: William Marshall Actors: Dean Fredericks, Coleen Gray, Anthony Dexter Production Company: Four Crown Productions Inc. Release Date: 13 December 1961 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.85 : 1 The mysterious appearance of an unknown planet brings miniature people, giant monsters, beautiful women and undaunted heroes to the screen. The self-contained planet "Rheton" has the ability to move in and out of galaxies to escape their enemies. Earth sends an astronaut team to investigate, which discovers miniature people. One astronaut survives to help them fight off monsters and Solorite attacks.

sources.title: The Phantom Planet
sources.description: A spaceship is drawn towards a planet populated by tiny people where the atmosphere shrinks the astronauts as well. This film was featured on the television program Mystery Science Theater 3000. You can find an MP4 of this film here . You can find out more about this film on its IMDB page .

sources.title: The Phantom Planet (1961) SCI-FI

Stars: Dean Fredericks, Coleen Gray, Anthony Dexter 
 Director: William Marshall

 After an invisible asteroid draws an astronaut and his ship to its surface, he is miniaturized by the phantom planet's exotic atmosphere.
